channel.title: Enigmail potentially encrypts subject lines?
channel.description:
It seems to be an experimental feature not officially enabled:
https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/21880

item.title: Enigmail potentially encrypts subject lines?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
entr0py:

Is it worth backporting from Buster in Whonix 14?

It would be cool but we’re lagging behind with maintenance of Whonix 13 as well as Whonix 14 development (stretch based Whonix release still not ready). Quite difficult remaining todo.

After Whonix 14 I want to slow down on features and work on bug fixing, refactoring, automation and tests.

Read full topic

item.title: Enigmail potentially encrypts subject lines?
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
Enabled by default now by TorBirdy 2.3: https://blog.torproject.org/our-latest-release-torbirdy-thunderbird-includes-new-enigmail-features

Unfortunately, 2.3 didn’t make it into Stretch[1]. It’s a pretty useful fail-safe. Is it worth backporting from Buster in Whonix 14?

[1] https://packages.debian.org/search?keywords=xul-ext-torbirdy&searchon=names&suite=all&section=all

Read full topic
